title: [Large-Scale] Foundational Course on Federated Learning Optimization: Network Resource Management and Language Data Processing Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic machine learning concepts and understanding of distributed learning principles, familiarity with natural language processing (NLP) terminology, and experience in text data preprocessing
context.additional_context: Emphasizing smartphone-based mobile learning environments, this program provides experiential learning in federated learning optimization under real-world network constraints through project-based assessments. It includes case studies on multilingual text processing and on-device language model optimization.

learning_goals: Learners design client grouping strategies using 2-hop communication protocols in limited network environments and analyze multilingual text data processing efficiency

In a hierarchical federated learning structure, adaptive client selection criteria can be applied to propose resource allocation strategies tailored to real-world scenarios, and optimization methods for computational resources required for language model updates can be explained.

Optimization strategies for federated learning parameter transmission, considering mobile device constraints, can be validated with experimental data, and language data compression techniques in low-bandwidth environments can be evaluated.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
